III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical Assistance was provided to the facility about the facility's treatment
program and report dates. The facility recently expanded their treatment
program from 90 days maximum to 120 days maximum. This consultant
reviewed with the treatment supervisor and chief administrator about reporting
requirements of the rules. This consultant spoke about how an initial report
needs to be completed within 30 days of admission and an updated report
should be completed at least once every 3 months after completing the initial
report. The facility had numerous smaller reports noting within the treatment
youth chart and the plan is to make them more comprehensive to follow the
rule requirements.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was provided to the facility about rehiring staff and what is
needed in the human resource file. It was reminded that if a staff member ends
employment and then restarts the following week later, they need to be treated
like a new hire with the training requirements and background checks.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were 2 substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. The first finding of maltreatment in care was within Special Investigation
2025SIC000060 dated 02/24/2024. This special investigation was a result of a
violation of staff not following the internal policy on relationships with residents. It
was found the staff shared personal and similar life circumstances with a youth and
when the youth noted having a crush on the staff member, the staff member never
reported this to the administrators. A Corrective Action Plan dated 2/28/2025 was
approved with the following action steps: The facility terminated the employee that
was involved within the situation immediately. The facility completed refresher
training with staff on boundaries. The Superintendent has implemented two-month
and four-month employee evaluations with new staff to increase more staff
oversight and to have a more positive relationship with administration.
The second finding of maltreatment in care was within Special Investigation
2025SIC0000327 dated 02/20/2025. This special investigation resulted in a staff
member allowing two youth to go into a storage room together to fight one another.
The staff members failed to report this to anyone. A Corrective Action Plan dated
03/03/2025 was approved with the following action steps. The facility terminated
the employee that was involved within the situation immediately. The facility
updated their storage room policy which now does not allow any youth to be in the
storage room with or without staff's present. All staff were trained on this policy.
The Superintendent has implemented two-month and four-month employee
evaluations with new staff to increase more staff oversight and staff to have a more
positive relationship with administration.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: Special
Investigation 2025SIC000060 dated 02/24/2024 with the CAP approval date of
02/28/2025. This special investigation was a result of a violation of staff not
following the internal policy on relationships with residents. It was found that the
staff shared personal and similar life circumstances with a youth and when the
youth noted having a crush on the staff member, the staff member never reported
this to the administrators. The CAP had the following action steps: The facility
terminated the employee that was involved within the situation immediately. The
facility completed refresher training with staff on boundaries. The Superintendent
has implemented two-month and four-month employee evaluations with new staff
to increase more staff oversight and staff to have a more positive relationship with

administration. This CAP was reviewed quarterly, and all action steps were
completed timely.
Special Investigation 2025SIC0000327 dated 02/20/2025 with a CAP approval
date of 03/03/2025. This special investigation resulted in a staff member allowing
two youth go into a storage room together to fight one another. The staff
members failed to report this to anyone. The CAP had the following action steps:
The facility terminated the employee that was involved within the situation
immediately. The facility updated their storage room policy which now does not
allow any youth to be in the storage room with or without staff's present. All staff
were trained on this policy. The Superintendent has implemented two-month and
four-month employee evaluations with new staff to increase more staff oversight
and staff to have a more positive relationship with administration. This CAP was
reviewed quarterly, and all action steps were completed timely.

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. Staff reported they have found recent trainings very helpful,
specifically the trauma informed trainings. It was reported that staff have seen the
benefits of the recent policy changes of making sure no youth have access to
closets. Staff reported there has been a more influx of youth with more mental
health concerns rather than just delinquency concerns like past years. They
reported that administration has been supportive with making sure there is training,
additional support, and making sure the youth have access to the county's
community mental health providers.
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection. The youth reported that if
they had to be in detention they would choose this facility. When asked to explain,
youth reported they feel safe, treated well by staff, and feel their voice is heard
when grievances are written. Youth reported there has been changes in the
kitchen which has improved the food, and they have enjoyed the new food that is

being provided. Youth reported staff only go hands on with a youth when a youth
is a danger to themselves or others. The youth had no concerns to report.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on August 7, 2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
